Marv Lush wrote:

> I tried doing a search on the JUnit group archive about this topic,
> but apparently all my years in college did not teach me how to use a
> search engine correctly...
> 
> I have spent the last month or two puttting a series of testSuites
> with about 2000 test cases.  I run these test cases by firing off a
> testRunner on the machine where my testCase code is located (locally).
> 
> The software I am testing is "supposed" to run on differnt OS's and
> different versions of the JVM, and various combinations of the two.
> 
> So my question is this: is there some app I can use to kick off my
> regression suite (ideally form a web-browser) on many machines of
> varying combinations of OS/JVMs remotely, BUT HAVE THE TESTS RUN ON
> THE REMOTE MACHINE'S OWN JVM??? Then the app should harvest all the
> results and put them ideally in HTML/XML format?

Cactus, maybe.
